title: Content Marketing Manager
company_info: Launched in the new millennium in February 2000, OrangeTee has since established itself as a reputable, dynamic and fast-growing real estate enterprise in Singapore. We have about 3100 management and support staff, real estate consultants and managers, property management specialists, and information technology consultants, working together with the single aim of providing a one-stop solution to the real estate needs of both corporate and individual clients. OrangeTee aims to be the most outstanding and respected real estate enterprise in the region. Our brand image is one of innovation, trustworthiness, value and service. What this means is that we provide unique and effective solutions to our clients and our wholehearted commitment to our customers will see us going the extra mile to not just meet but exceed customers’ expectations.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Develop compelling brand stories and sales pitches for marketing campaigns that generate membership and sales growth, engagement, lead generation, and brand awareness.
Copy write and produce shareable and engaging digital media content, such as infographics, videos, and images, etc. that inspires and moves hearts and minds.
Collaborating with content owners to ideate and develop communications tactics and materials to facilitate the business objectives and marketing outcomes, including EDMs, Brochures, pull-up banners, standees, and video storyboards, etc.
Support content updates to creative assets, websites, mobile apps, videos, and other online and offline collaterals to upkeep branding, marketing messaging, and engagement efforts.
Execute a quarterly content marketing calendar that supports a wide variety of marketing and communications activities online.
Project manage tasks under your portfolio and help ensure that project/department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approved budgets.
Educate internal departments on best practices for social content creation and marketing.
Job Requirements
Tertiary degree or internationally recognised qualification in Marketing, Mass Communications, Public Relations, or Digital Marketing.
3 - 5 years as an individual contributor in the area of branding, content creation, and/or marketing and communications, with 1-2 years of staff management experience.
You have a proven ability to work at both strategic and tactical levels, and you're not afraid to dive into details and execute.
Strong content strategy and development skills: able to piece together disparate or silo-ed marketing campaigns or material into one overarching coherent story.
Experience running integrated marketing campaigns with both traditional and digital media in Singapore.
Proficient in Social Media Platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube; as well as Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel, and pivot tables with ease to interpret the results; and familiarity with Google Tag Manager and DoubleClick Campaign Manager.
Independent, meticulous, resourceful and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as a keen eye for detail and design aesthetics.
Experience with multiple content formats from thought leadership pieces to infographics to videos to editorial is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication in English. Good command in a second language is also preferred.
Strategic planning skills, display excellent leadership and be a good team player that is able to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Confidence in suggesting new ideas and challenging senior stakeholders if required.
Please send us your detailed resume stating your expected salary and availability together with a content portfolio.

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Senior Campaign Manager, Content Marketing
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
SPH Content Lab is looking an exceptional talent to join our growing content marketing team as Senior Campaign Manager. The ideal candidate excels at strategic thinking, target-focused ideation, and project management. Must. Love. Content.

You must be able to see the big picture while zooming in on the details. This is a job for someone who doesn’t just enjoy managing the complete life cycle of complex, cross-functional content marketing projects across the SPH Media ecosystem, but also spends time on the content strategy – figuring out the best way to solutioning a client brief while thinking about what the audience wants.

Reporting to the Associate Director of Content Marketing, you’ll design, produce and manage multi-format content marketing campaigns that include video, social media, text stories, audio and print. You will be at the forefront of connecting clients to SPH Content Lab’s performance-focused, editorial-driven solutions. You must be passionate about bringing content to life, seeing it through from the initial concept to the final performance report. Experience managing projects and clients is essential.

The ideal candidate is organised, media-savvy, and knows how to problem-solve while managing their time effectively. Our client list is diverse, and so is our content. You must be an experienced idea generator who is passionate about developing stories that will resonate with audiences – always with an eye on the larger goals of the content campaign and how each component of the project impacts the intended KPIs.

Content Lab works with an army of freelancers to bring our concepts to life – you run the show, on time and on budget. Experience with project management and overseeing many moving parts, assignments, and deliverables at once is a necessity. You must be able to work well as part of a team, collaborating with a larger group of editors, creatives, and colleagues from our commercial unit.

A high-level knowledge of news and current affairs is necessary, as well as an understanding of how to present a unique take in a crowded content landscape. The ability to thrive under pressure, manage intense deadlines and collaborate well with others is key.

Experience in video production is preferred.

SCOPE & RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and create fully integrated content marketing strategies that incorporate online and off-line channels.
Manage the complete life cycle of custom-solutioned, multi-format, cross-platform content marketing projects across the considerable roster of SPH Media’s news and lifestyle brands. This includes client pitches, project management, client management, performance supervision, and reporting.
Contribute to ideation and solutioning of client briefs, and craft pitch decks of the highest standards.
Managing internal stakeholders as well as external production partners to make sure a million moving parts produce content that is to brief, on time, and under budget.
Turn data and analytics into strategy and action.
Mentor junior members of the team.
REQUIREMENTS
A minimum of 6 years relevant industry experience with at least 3 years in editorial, content marketing, social media marketing, advertising or video production.
Clear understanding of how content is created across formats and media platforms. Experience in managing content creation on more than two media platforms (digital, social, print, television, radio, etc) is mandatory.
Proven ability to devise strategic cross-platform content strategies and concepts.
Experience in turning data and analytics into strategy and action. Basic understanding of digital analytics is a must.
An extraordinary gift for multitasking. Please be extremely organised and detail-oriented.
Be able to work collaboratively and proactively.
Excellent English-language verbal and written skills. Proficiency in Chinese, Malay or Tamil is a bonus.
Strong understanding of Lifestyle industry and consumer trends.
Familiarity with SPH’s news products is essential.
Must play well with others.
Bachelor in Mass Communication, Marketing or related field.

title: Regulatory Affairs Content Marketing Manager
company_info: RegASK is a global RegTech company provides regulatory consulting services by leveraging their in-house AI based platform capability combined with regulatory team expertise for devising path-to market, path to claim, market expansion etc. strategies for FMCG, MedTech, Pharma companies across the globe. RegASK was newly created by the founders of SPRIM, after more than 17 years of consulting on globalization projects and researching regulatory guidelines for healthcare companies across six of the seven continents. RegASK is backed by a team of regulatory experts with a global perspective and years of navigating some of the most complicated regulatory hurdles in markets big and small.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We, at RegASK are a high growth global RegTech company leveraging technology and global network of experts to revolutionize regulatory intelligence, serving the LifeSciences (MedTech, CROs, Pharma) and FMCG industries (Food, Personal Care). RegASK team is highly diverse with more than 10 nationalities across 3 continents, entrepreneurial and very agile, enjoying the benefits of working across industries and across the globe. RegASK just completed its series A funding round in December 2022 and is currently recruiting highly motivated talents to expand its team and support its ambitious growth plans.
RegASK is an international, diverse and rewarding place to work. If you are a builder, highly autonomous in your working style, and eager to problem solve, we would love to hear from you.
RegASK is part of Sprim Global Investments portfolio, a group of 500+ people in 19 offices across 6 continents, finding solutions, discovering and implementing new ideas to deliver better health.
The Position:
Are you a skilled and strategic marketer with a passion for creating compelling content that drives engagement and conversion? Are you excited about the opportunity to drive growth and engage audiences in the B2B sector? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our dynamic team as a Content Marketing Manager at RegASK.
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute a comprehensive content marketing strategy that aligns with the company's objectives and target audience, aligning with the Marketing and Sales teams the content marketing strategy and execute the content plan so that it aligns with the company's goals and objectives.
Create high-quality engaging and informative content for various platforms, including blog posts, website, gated content assets, articles, whitepapers, case studies, social media, and email campaigns.
Conduct in-depth research on regulatory affairs industry to identify industry trends, target audience preferences, and competitor activities to inform and develop original content creation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product marketing, sales, and design, to ensure content briefing, consistency and effectiveness.
Manage and optimize the company's content distribution channels, including website, blog, social media platforms, and email marketing.
Assist the marketing team in developing content for advertising campaigns.
Proofread content for errors and inconsistencies, editing and polishing existing content to improve readability.
Use analytics tools to track and analyze content performance metrics, such as engagement, conversion rates, and lead generation, and use the insights to refine future content strategies
Stay updated on the latest industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to drive continuous improvement in content marketing efforts.
Write content optimized for SEO to improve the visibility of our brand and attract more traffic to our website.
Collaborate when needed with external partners, such as other content creators, graphic designers, videographers, subject matter experts, and influencers, and oversee their work to ensure high-quality output and adherence to brand guidelines.
Collaborate with SEO specialists to optimize content for search engines and increase organic traffic.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, English Literature, Journalism, Communications, or a related field. Advanced degree is a plus.
5+ years of experience in content marketing and writing, with a focus on regulatory affairs.
Proven experience as a Content Marketing Manager or a similar role, preferably in a B2B environment.
Strong understanding of B2B marketing strategies and the ability to create content that resonates with a professional audience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with exceptional attention to detail.
Demonstrated expertise in content creation, including writing, editing, and proofreading.
Experience with SEO best practices and tools
Proficiency in utilizing content management systems (CMS, WordPress), analytics tools and marketing automation tools.
Knowledge of regulatory procedures / systems / guidance is a plus. Ideal candidate will also have content writing background or working experience within Life Science or FMCG industries.
Excellent English writing and editing skills, with the ability to create content that is engaging and informative.
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Self-motivated, creative thinker with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment (Expertise in collaborating with internal and external partners).
Why Join RegASK?
Opportunity to work with a market leader in the B2B industry, with a focus on innovation and excellence.
Collaborative and supportive work environment that values employee growth and development.
benefits package.
Room for professional growth and advancement within the company.
Access to resources to enhance your skills.
How to Apply:
If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and qualifications to excel as our Content Marketing Manager, please submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for the role.
A portfolio of published articles is required for review, during the recruitment process.
We appreciate all applications, but only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Thank you for considering joining the RegASK team. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Senior Content Marketing Manager
company_info: CompareAsiaGroup is Asia’s leading financial management platform for banking & insurance. CompareAsiaGroup helps people across Asia save time and make better choices with comprehensive, free and independent online comparison tools for personal loans, credit cards, insurance and home services. Headquartered in Hong Kong, CompareAsiaGroup is active in seven Asian markets including Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, Indonesia, the Philippines, Malaysia and Thailand. The Group has established relationships with over 100 leading financial institutions and employs more than 200 people. CompareAsiaGroup has raised more than USD 90 million from leading investors including IFC (part of the World Bank Group), Goldman Sachs, Alibaba, SBI Group, ACE & Company, and H&Q Asia Pacific. Join us as one of the fastest growing, young enterprises in Asia as we revolutionize the financial and insurance industries through technology.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
THE ROLE
We are on the hunt for a data driven Senior Content Marketing Manager who will be responsible for driving the overall content strategy, enabling SingSaver to create engaging and empowering financial content to help people make informed decisions. This role will require you to be an expert in all things content related and excel in channel optimisation, brand consistency, analytics and meaningful measurement.

YOUR TASK
Build a comprehensive content marketing strategy that spans the entire marketing funnel and effectively engages our target audience segments
Identify, evaluate and implement content opportunities, partnerships and initiatives to meet strategic business objectives
Always with the SEO hat on, lead content creation across a variety of formats, including blogs, whitepapers, videos, emails, social posts, ad copy, landing pages, guides, and more
Stay abreast of market developments and monitor the competitive landscape to position the company as the market leader. Conduct competitor and keyword gap analysis to find opportunities to widen organic demand capture for key verticals
Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality and tone of voice across all channels including online, social media, email and video. Balance between search engine optimisation and trends to ensure that all content adds value to the consumer
Adapt content and messaging across channels (videos, infographics, long form articles, newsletters) etc to drive traffic, engagement and leads
Manage content distribution to online channels and social media platforms to increase web traffic
Ensure data is thoroughly analyzed and recommendations are made based on those results.
Oversee the integration of content activities within marketing campaigns.
Develop standards, systems and best practices for content creation, distribution, maintenance, content retrieval and content repurposing
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations or related communications field.
8+ years of experience as a respected leader in multichannel content creation for different target demographics.
Prior experience in Social Media and Public Relations is a plus
3+ years of experience in managing large teams
Outstanding command of the English language
Keen interest in the world of personal finance
Proven experience in developing and implementing a successful content strategy
Clear understanding of business goals behind Content’s purpose, and fluent in web analytics tools (Google Analytics) and social media analytic tools
Ideal candidates should have a keen eye for detail, strong research skills, and possess a good understanding of SEO principles and keyword demand
Good experience of finding creative freelancers and getting outsourced work done where necessary
KEY SKILLS
Be patient, empathetic, and customer-obsessed: We're happy only when our customers are happy
A relentless sense of responsibility and ownership in problem-solving
The ability to adapt quickly to the fast-paced start-up environment, to process new information on the go and translate that into customer-friendly language
Self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption
Team management experience, including the ability to lead and inspire a high performing team
Project management skills to manage large teams and competing priorities
A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly

title: Marketing Associate
company_info: AM Collective is the parent company of Alvinology.com and is the marketing arm of Singapore mobile app development house, Originally US. We are a digital agency based in Singapore, providing refreshing creative services and ideas to businesses that want to grow online. We help businesses with their digital goals by utilising industry insights and technical skills. AM Collective is a digital agency that also owns a group of digital properties.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
AM Collective is a dynamic full-service marketing agency offering tailored solutions to help businesses grow and thrive. We specialize in branding consultancy, social media marketing, creative production, search engine optimization, paid media, and software development. Our unified approach leverages strategy, design, and digital expertise, ensuring a competitive edge for our clients. By prioritizing data-driven decisions, customized strategy, and a commitment to excellence, we forge lasting partnerships and deliver measurable results for businesses across various industries.

We seek a motivated and talented Marketing Associate to join our growing team at AM Collective. This role offers the opportunity to work on diverse projects, manage client relationships, and contribute to our client's success across multiple digital channels. We'd love to hear from you if you have a passion for digital marketing, strong communication skills, and the ability to adapt and learn quickly.
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement digital marketing campaigns across various platforms, including social media, email, and content marketing
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and quality output
Coordinate with the creative team to produce engaging content, including copywriting, graphics, and video production
Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance and provide recommendations for improvement
Build and maintain strong client relationships through regular communication, updates, and meetings
Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve campaign effectiveness
Collaborate with team members to develop strategies and execute initiatives that align with clients' goals
Requirements:
Minimum of 1-year relevant work experience in digital marketing
Strong understanding of social media marketing, copywriting, and content production
Excellent project management and organizational skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on client servicing
Data-driven mindset and familiarity with analytics tools to measure and optimize campaign performance
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment
Fresh graduates and mid-career switch candidates with a strong passion for digital marketing are welcome to apply
Benefits:
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits and health insurance coverage
Subsidised phone bills as part of our employee benefits package
Flexible working hours and remote work options
To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and portfolio showcasing your relevant experience and skills. We look forward to hearing from you!
